memberdef.argsstring: (const UsdPrim &prim)
memberdef.name: UsdSkelIsSkelAnimationPrim

briefdescription.para: Returns true if prim is a valid skel animation source.

memberdef.argsstring: (const UsdPrim &prim)
memberdef.name: UsdSkelIsSkinnablePrim

briefdescription.para: Returns true if prim is considered to be a skinnable primitive.

detaileddescription.para: Whether or not the prim is actually skinned additionally depends on whether or not the prim has a bound skeleton, and prop joint influences.

memberdef.argsstring: (const UsdSkelTopology &topology, TfSpan< const GfMatrix4d > xforms, TfSpan< const GfMatrix4d > inverseXforms, TfSpan< GfMatrix4d > jointLocalXforms, const GfMatrix4d *rootInverseXform=nullptr)
memberdef.name: UsdSkelComputeJointLocalTransforms

briefdescription.para: Compute joint transforms in joint-local space.

detaileddescription.para: Transforms are computed from xforms, holding concatenated joint transforms, and inverseXforms, providing the inverse of each of those transforms. The resulting local space transforms are written to jointLocalXforms, which must be the same size as topology. If the root joints include an additional, external transformation eg., such as the skel local-to-world transformation then the inverse of that transform should be passed as rootInverseXform. If no rootInverseXform is provided, then xform and inverseXforms should be based on joint transforms computed in skeleton space. Each transform array must be sized to the number of joints from topology.

memberdef.argsstring: (const UsdSkelTopology &topology, TfSpan< const GfMatrix4f > xforms, TfSpan< const GfMatrix4f > inverseXforms, TfSpan< GfMatrix4f > jointLocalXforms, const GfMatrix4f *rootInverseXform=nullptr)
memberdef.name: UsdSkelComputeJointLocalTransforms

detaileddescription.para: This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

memberdef.argsstring: (const UsdSkelTopology &topology, TfSpan< const GfMatrix4d > xforms, TfSpan< GfMatrix4d > jointLocalXforms, const GfMatrix4d *rootInverseXform=nullptr)
memberdef.name: UsdSkelComputeJointLocalTransforms

briefdescription.para: Compute joint transforms in joint-local space.

detaileddescription.para: This is a convenience overload, which computes the required inverse transforms internally.

memberdef.argsstring: (const UsdSkelTopology &topology, TfSpan< const GfMatrix4f > xforms, TfSpan< GfMatrix4f > jointLocalXforms, const GfMatrix4f *rootInverseXform=nullptr)

memberdef.name: UsdSkelConcatJointTransforms

briefdescription.para: Compute concatenated joint transforms.

detaileddescription.para: This concatenates transforms from jointLocalXforms, providing joint transforms in joint-local space. The resulting transforms are written to jointLocalXforms, which must be the same size as topology. If rootXform is not provided, or is the identity, the resulting joint transforms will be given in skeleton space. Any additional transformations may be provided on rootXform if an additional level of transformation such as the skel local to world transform are desired. Each transform array must be sized to the number of joints from topology.

memberdef.argsstring: (const UsdSkelTopology &topology, TfSpan< const GfMatrix4f > jointLocalXforms, TfSpan< GfMatrix4f > xforms, const GfMatrix4f *rootXform=nullptr)
memberdef.name: UsdSkelConcatJointTransforms

memberdef.name: UsdSkelDecomposeTransform

detaileddescription.para: The transform order for decomposition is scale, rotate, translate.

memberdef.name: UsdSkelNormalizeWeights

memberdef.name: UsdSkelExpandConstantInfluencesToVarying

briefdescription.para: Convert an array of constant influences (joint weights or indices) to an array of varying influences.

detaileddescription.para: The size should match the size of required for 'vertex' interpolation on the type geometry primitive. Typically, this is the number of points. This is a convenience function for clients that don't understand constant (rigid) weighting.

memberdef.argsstring: (VtFloatArray *weights, size_t size)
memberdef.name: UsdSkelExpandConstantInfluencesToVarying

detaileddescription.para: This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

memberdef.argsstring: (VtIntArray *indices, int srcNumInfluencesPerComponent, int newNumInfluencesPerComponent)
memberdef.name: UsdSkelResizeInfluences

briefdescription.para: Resize the number of influences per component in a weight or indices array, which initially has srcNumInfluencesPerComponent influences to have no more than newNumInfluencesPerComponent influences per component.

detaileddescription.para: If the size decreases, influences are additionally re-normalized. This is a convenience method for clients that require a fixed number of of influences.

memberdef.argsstring: (VtFloatArray *weights, int srcNumInfluencesPerComponent, int newNumInfluencesPerComponent)
memberdef.name: UsdSkelResizeInfluences

memberdef.name: UsdSkelSkinPoints

briefdescription.para: Skin points using linear blend skinning (LBS) or dual quaternion skinning (DQS).

detaileddescription.para: The jointXforms are skinning transforms, given in skeleton space, while the geomBindTransform provides the transform that transforms the initial points into the same skeleton space that the skinning transforms were computed in.

memberdef.argsstring: (const TfToken &skinningMethod, const GfMatrix4f &geomBindTransform, TfSpan< const GfMatrix4f > jointXforms, TfSpan< const int > jointIndices, TfSpan< const float > jointWeights, int numInfluencesPerPoint, TfSpan< GfVec3f > points, bool inSerial=false)

memberdef.name: UsdSkelSkinNormals

briefdescription.para: Skin normals using linear blend skinning (LBS) or dual quaternion skinning (DQS), for normals with vertex or varying interpolation.

detaileddescription.para: Use UsdSkelSkinFaceVaryingNormals() for normals with _faceVarying__ interpolation. The jointXforms are the inverse transposes of the 3x3 component of the UsdSkel_Term_SkinningTransforms" "skinning transforms", given in skeleton space. The geomBindTransform is the inverse transpose of the matrix that transforms points from a bind pose ino the same skeleton space that the skinning tranforms were computed in.

memberdef.argsstring: (const TfToken &skinningMethod, const GfMatrix3f &geomBindTransform, TfSpan< const GfMatrix3f > jointXforms, TfSpan< const int > jointIndices, TfSpan< const float > jointWeights, int numInfluencesPerPoint, TfSpan< GfVec3f > normals, bool inSerial=false)

memberdef.name: UsdSkelApplyBlendShape

briefdescription.para: Apply a single blend shape to points.

detaileddescription.para: The shape is given as a span of offsets. If the indices span is not empty, it provides the index into the points span at which each offset should be mapped. Otherwise, the offsets span must be the same size as the points span.

briefdescription.para: Collection of utility methods.
